page.title: 09COLLEGE OF AERONAUTICS.
page.content: The{ College of Aeronautics} was set up after World War 2 in 1946. They design, make, test and fit parts or complete aircraft. Most of the work is making or repairing parts for other firms or people. Everyone actually working there has a degree in engin- eering, including students,who come to Cranfield for a unique training course in aeronautics. Part of this unique nature stems from the College owning its own airfield and aircraft. The College has many sophisticated testing systems to discover the poten- tial of new and existing materials. They have two wind tunnels and an impact centre, which also does test work for the automotive industry. In the future the College plans to escalate their involvement in all fields of aeronautics.
